intro: Epilobium hohuanense, commonly known as the Hohuan willowherb, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to parts of East Asia, particularly China, where it grows in moist, often shaded environments. The plant features slender, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and numerous stamens, typical of the Onagraceae family. Epilobium hohuanense is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other damp habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
